Articles.Content: I am trying to add an RCS module to the MIRVS in my ICBM mod(http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/221201-icbm-parts). I know how to add a module in a .cfg file, but I don't know how to make an RCS module with custom port locations. Can anyone help me?

Welcome to the forums!

I think you're talking about making a custom *part* with RCS transforms? And I think you'd get the best answer in the Modeling and Texturing subforum, so off we go. Meanwhile you can check and see if there's anything relevant to you in this sticky.

The locations for the RCS thrusters is defined in the model(typically added to the model in Unity as empty game objects). The module added in the config file tells the game what the empty gameobjects that represent the RCS thrusters are called in the model. So in the model for your missile, you'll add the empty game objects in all the right places, then just add the module to the .cfg and you're done. The stickies will show you the details!
